back-office operations once the trade is

wants to carry out the trade they handle

there are certain obligations that it

then there is the ultimate anti-fraud

free from liability did have a
responsibility of saying something
because they actually had actual

there's actually a true risk of

implications because traditionally
clearing firms do not have any

their clients there they are free of

providers if with any type of decision
where a clearing firm is found to be

Goldman Sachs is being it's over 20
million dollars in liability suddenly
every firm that provides these types of
clearing services will be very
frightened that they too may be found
liable they'll have to invest more in
compliance activities they'll have to
spend more on monitoring what
investors are doing and this in turn
will raise the costs of providing
clearance services clearance services is
a highly profitable part of the industry
it's a relatively straightforward
activity at their handling but they get
to charge a nice fee for it so you're

area of the financial services industry

something that they traditionally have
